news.title: ‘I’ll still be eating ham and cheese sambos’ – family syndicate comes forward to claim €250m EuroMillions jackpot
news.summary: The winners of the historic €250 million EuroMillions jackpot say they were in "complete disbelief" when they found out about their life-changing win last month.

news.title: Former All-Ireland hurler Niall Gilligan ‘just kept hitting me’ with stick during alleged assault, boy told gardaí
news.summary: A 12-year old boy told gardaí that All-Star and former Clare All-Ireland winning hurler, Niall Gilligan hit him “full force” with a stick during an alleged assault in October 2023.

news.title: Explainer: What exactly is going on with An Post?
news.summary: An Post is as synonymous with Ireland as green fields and rainy days. Since the modern-day version was founded in 1984 (succeeding the Department of Posts and Telegraphs), there can’t be a person in the country who has never had to post a letter in some shape or form.

news.title: Joseph Grogan inquest concludes with widow in tears and bombshell accusations
news.summary: Lisa Flaherty stormed out of the packed room, visibly angered. The sugg­estion that she had been in a relationship with Joseph Grogan since she was 16 had caused his family “endless ­anxiety”, solicitor and senior counsel Damien Tansey was telling the court.

news.title: ‘It was pretty stressful’ – Ben Healy stays in yellow at Tour de France as Tadej Pogacar crashes near finish of stage 11
news.summary: Ireland’s Ben Healy managed to hold onto his yellow jersey of race leader at the Tour de France for another day today after a hectic stage 11 saw the first rider to attack this morning, Norwegian Jonas Abrahamsen of Uno-X Mobility, claim his maiden Tour stage win into Toulouse.

news.title: Ballymena schoolgirl allegedly ‘raped’ after being dragged into garage by three males, court hears
news.summary: A Ballymena schoolgirl was walking along a street in the town when she was allegedly dragged into a garage, then raped and sexually assaulted by three males, a court heard today.

news.title: Electricity boss acknowledges stress caused to 80 families locked out of new homes without power
news.summary: The head of the electricity network has acknowledged the stress suffered by families prevented from moving into their new homes because their estate has no power.

news.title: Dealer at ‘highest level’ of Dublin drugs network is jailed for 15 years
news.summary: A married father-of-four who led a Dublin drug cell has been jailed for 15 years after being caught with €10m in drugs and cash as well as a stolen garda uniform.

news.title: Skin cancer survivor urges people to act fast – ‘I wouldn’t have been the type to go to the doctor’
news.summary: Skin cancer survivor, Stephen Gray, is encouraging people to get any skin changes of concern checked immediately, after his own experience of being diagnosed with a malignant melanoma.

news.title: Money Talks: Fionnuala Jones: ‘I really don't panic about things that I probably should be panicking about’
news.summary: Cork native Fionnuala Jones has grafted hard to become a regular and lively presence in Ireland’s ever-evolving media landscape.
